conclusion: Understand the properties of a cylindrical optical element and the behavior of light in such an environment.
Identify the given information: refractive index n = 2, center of the arc at point O, point source of light at point O, arc AC has radius R, light source directly incident on arc AC.
Understand the geometry: light source at point O, light incident on arc AC, refractive index n = 2, light refracted at interface between material and air.
Calculate the angle of incidence and refraction: angle of incidence θi is arcsin(1/n) = arcsin(1/2) = 30°, angle of refraction θr is arcsin(1/2) = 30°.

Calculate the length of the arc: length of arc AC can be found using formula for circumference of a circle, angle of arc θ = 30°, length of arc AC is (θ/360°) × 2πR = (30°/360°) × 2πR = (1/12) × 2πR = πR/6.
Conclusion: The length of the arc where the lights are incident is πR/6.
